Reviews.Title: “Location vs everything else”
Reviews.Author: pmotton
Reviews.Content: Located betwen the Plaza Mayor and the Puerta del Sol in a mostly pedestrian area, this hotel gets top marks for location. However, as a hotel, it leaves a lot to be desired. More like a hostel, it is cramped both in the rooms and in the public areas. My room was shaped like something out of a Kafka movie. The staff was off-handed in greeting me and sluggish not to say churlish in responding to my questions in Spanish about the hotel and local attractions. By all means sleep and shower at this hotel for the convenience but go elsewhere for everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: pksolecki
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for two nights upon our arrival in Spain. The location is mere steps from Plaza Mayor and Plaza del Sol. Our room was tiny but adequate, and the staff helpful if not overly friendly. There was a full, adequate breakfast buffet, though not included in the room rate. We had intended to take the subway, which is only a block away, but Madrid is so intimate and walkable that we never rode it, instead walking everywhere, including the Prado and the neighborhoods to the south and southeast. The room was also extremely quiet, especially for such a noisy neighborhood. So although the room was nothing special, I highly recommend this hotel for its location and convenient access.

Reviews.Title: “I was very surprised - in a good way”
Reviews.Author: 231Liz
Reviews.Content: I went during my spring break - Easter time. There was four of us traveling together and I was skeptical about the accommodations since the other three travelers were on a budget. The room was centrally located to the Plaza but I would have preferred a location closer to the "action". Our room was 2-stories with the first floor equipped with a desk and a chair (wasted space). You have to walk up a spiral staircase (with your luggage) to get to the bedroom. The bedroom had four beds - a full and three singles. My bed was underneath the roof line so I had to be careful and not hit my head - I did not succeed. The room also had two desks, windows without curtains or screens, and plenty of outlets. Like a previous reviewer wrote - the bathroom did not afford complete privacy. Fine for a family but maybe not good for friends. But it was beautiful. We (or should I say my traveling companions) had the breakfast buffet in the hotel restaurant. I am not a breakfast person and when I do have it I want a good selection. This buffet did not meet my needs for the price. Would I stay here for a week? No, but it was good for my short stay and for the price. Also, it is a four-star (European rating).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Gilly456
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and found the hotel to be lovely. I have seen some reviews here which say that the rooms are small, I can see why some people might think that, but for a European Hotel I would say that the rooms are of average size. We booked at triple room and had 3 proper single beds, which I will admit were somewhat on the hard side. However, the room was fine, we had a smal balcony looking out over a side street, air conditioning and a nice bathroom with a very good shower. The only slight issue was that the sink seemed to leak. The only thing which would have been nice was to have tea making facilities in the room. However there was a small tea station in reception and anyway Starbucks is about 2 minutes walk away so we just went there to fetch our tea in the morning and brought it back to the room. The reception staff were very friendly and the location is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed. Excellent facilities, free laptop with Internet in room, free drinks in reception after 12 noon. Well appointed rooms, helpful staff, and probably the best city centre location in Central Madrid. Good Value for a 4 Star hotel if you book online. Highly recommended, we will use again next time we are in Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel by the Plaza Mayor”
Reviews.Author: Travelchicme
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite lovely from the outside, at least for me who loves old structures. Despite its age, the building is really maintained and the rooms though more hi tech compliments the overall feel of the place. It is literally a few steps away from the Plaza Mayor and for its price, I must admit it is quite a bargain. Lots of restaurants surrounding the area so you'll never run out of food options. Will definitely stay in the hotel again in my nexr visit to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: andi0527
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on our way back from our trip to North Africa. We booked a family room as we had 2 adults and 2 teens. The family room we were given when we checked in was on the 4th floor and had a sloped ceiling. It felt like we were sleeping in a cave and if you didn't bend down when you walked around you would hit your head. It made us feel very claustrophobic. They really shouldn't be selling that as a room. We went to the front desk and complained. They told us we could switch rooms but not until the 2nd night. When we went to the front desk the next morning to switch rooms the front desk clerk told us we had to pack every thing and he didn't know when another room would be available. He told us we had to bring our luggage downstairs and he would lock it up with other guests luggage in little area in the lobby. It didn't feel very safe having our luggage with other guests luggage as anyone could pick up ours when they picked up theirs. When we made a deal of it another family room magically became available. The family room we received was better with a normal ceiling. 1. The bunk bed in the family room- My teen daughter who slept in the top bunk had to climb the ladder to get there. It didn't seem very secure. As she climbed the ladder it swung around and didn't stay put which could cause an injury. I had to hold it so she didn't fall. 2. The bathroom- As previous reviewers have said the bathrooms have a frosted door which doesn't give you a feeling of privacy. There is no bath tub which there should be for a 4 star. The shower head is very nice but there is a opening in the shower area with no door which makes it impossible to take a shower without getting the whole bathroom wet. 3. Breakfast- breakfast was good with fresh fruit, cereals, yogurt, pastries, etc. There was a lot of pork. We don't eat pork so we just didn't eat that part. The hotel is in a great location if you want to be in a place to walk around. If you don't have a lot of time we recommend the tour bus. We took that and it was very worth it. You see more than if you try to do it on your own. You can get off at various stops and get back on whenever you feel like it. If you compare this hotel to a 4 star hotel in the US there are definitely not the same standards. But, we would stay here again for the convenience of the location and a family room which it doesn't seem is easy to find in Madrid unless you stay at a Petit Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic central location”
Reviews.Author: ohdesi74
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right in the center of the city and is walking distance to a lot of fun stuff in La Latina, Sol, Gran Via, Paseo del Prado etc. The metro is about 4 mins away and so getting to and from the airport is easy. The rooms are a bit small, but you're in the middle of the city! Great wifi and nice staff. Can't go wrong with this choice.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Glass Box”
Reviews.Author: mefal04
Reviews.Content: So surprised by the good reviews, yes the location was amazing, but that was all. The beds were hard as a rock and they only gave you a thin brown blanket as the top sheet. Our room- a family room, was just a room , no doors, and the one wall was a frosted glass walls. The bathroom door was a swinging glass door. My kids could play peek-a boo, I see you, through the sides of the door. 4 stars it is not!!! The greatest thing was the shower jets, but bathroom had peeling paint on the ceiling and mold in the corners on the floor of the shower. The computer in our room did not work the 1st 2 days and when it did, it was very slow. So you pay for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: HelenMarie1981
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect, between Plaza del Sol and Plaza Mayor and in walking distance of good areas for eating and drinking. Sol is also served well by the Metro and easy to navigate from. We had a ground floor room so were worried that it may be noisy as backed onto a street but the double glazing worked and we didn't hear a thing. The buffet breakfast is fantastic and in a lovely setting. Good choice of hot and cold foods with juices and hot drinks, plenty of space. The staff were good, typically Madrid and not overly friendly but you'll see that's how everyone is in the City! Overall, good value, great location and a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, hotel needs thorough cleaning and friendly staff...”
Reviews.Author: Remco S
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for a stay in Madrid at 20m away from the Plaza Mayor. Nicely decorated hotel with big enough rooms. Only negative point: The rooms need more thorough cleaning: A lot of dust webs on the ceiling and a mouldy ceiling in the shower are not acceptable for a 4-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a pleasent experience”
Reviews.Author: JAELIZABETH
Reviews.Content: Stayed 17th – 20th May 2012 as previous reviews you can’t beat the location but that is the only positive. This hotel charges 4 star prices for a 2 star experience. Our room was tiny the beds were really uncomfortable and the design of the bathroom meant that there was no privacy what so ever when in use! Yes there was a high tech shower but freezing cold water. As for the staff at reception the seemed just disinterested.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing staff and amenities marginally eclipsed by great location”
Reviews.Author: pickles99
Reviews.Content: Despite there being 3 adults, we booked a family room as pricing and room descriptions indicated being more spacious than the a triple room. After booking through Expedia, I telephoned the hotel directly over a month in advance to explain our reasons for booking a family room rather than a triple and was assured by the head receptionist (Marta) that we will be allocated a larger of the family room and that she has made a note against our booking regarding this. When we arrived to check in, despite there being 3 of us at the reception desk, we found that we were given the keys to a twin room. After traipsing all our luggage up, and after a long day's travel, I must say this was highly irritating. I then had to have a long and detailed conversation at the duty receptionist to rectify this - who was highly rude and uttered not a single word of apology for their mistake. This particular receptionist continued his rude behaviour throughout our stay there. The room we were finally given was no bigger than the standard twin with bunk beds squeezed in. They seem to call themselves a high tech hotel, but the wifi was sketchy at best and the only thing high tech was the laptop provided and the shower (which was totally impractical if you wanted to avoid flooding the bathroom). I must stay they should focus on getting the basics right - such: as locks on the bathroom, proper bathroom door rather than a frosted on to avoid disturbing others in the middle of the night, providing enough hand soap, supplying irons, bath matts, sufficient pillows as standard rather than having to ask for this, also things like "do-not-disturb" tags, slighly softer mattresses, better storage for clothes, mirror in the room rather than just the one in the bathroom, repairing the water damage in the bathroom ceiling (see picture!) etc. I good go on. It definitely was not 4*!! more like 2-3*! Best bit was the location, a stone's throw to Plaza Mayor made up for it somewhat...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: margaret h
Reviews.Content: You couldn't find a better location for sightseeing: just a few yards from the Plaza Mayor down a quiet street. Nearly all the main sights are within walking distance. The staff are friendly and helpful but not all reception staff spoke English. The room was OK but I have three minor quibbles. The shower worked fine, except that it was difficult not to flood the floor while using it - could have done with a proper door. The bed was rather hard. The free wi-fi was rather slow. I can't comment on the value for money as we didn't pay for it! I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a very convenient central location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. I wanted near Plaza Major and this is about as close as it gets! Room a bit small bt made up by a fantastic bathroom and walk in shower. Suprisingly quiet given its central location. Recommnd Emma's bar and restaurant near the new market by Plaza Major - great Tapas.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Neocy
Reviews.Content: average hotel, nothing special, but the location is great. you are right in the center

Reviews.Title: “Family Trip to Spain”
Reviews.Author: George D
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the heart of Madrid. Near both the Plaza de Sol and the Plaza de Mayor. Very courteous staff who spoke multiple languages. Relatively large rooms (for a large European city) with accommodations for a family of 4. Very clean with a great shower. We had a room centrally located in the hotel so it was quiet at night. An important fact if you want to get some sleep. The streets of Madrid are active until the early morning hours.

Reviews.Title: “Right where you want to be”
Reviews.Author: TravellingTibby
Reviews.Content: In the pedestrian area right off Plaza Major. Plenty of people around for late night returns. Breakfast ample and varied. And you can linger as long as you want. Lap top in every room. Nice big rooms with jet stream showers. All in all great experience. Reception area a little shoddy otherwise an excellent but the rooms divine.

Reviews.Title: “If this hotel was rated 3 stars I would not be complaining.”
Reviews.Author: MilesUnderground
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot in Europe and around the world. I absolutely HATE booking into a hotel claiming to be a four star when really it is a three star, it is a very unpleasant surprise on arrival. I am starting my review by telling you that this is a THREE star hotel, not a FOUR star hotel as advertised. Do NOT expect a four star pampering or a romantic environment for a honeymoon in Madrid, etc. etc. Beds: Look nice, but equipped with three star mattress and pillows - unpleasant after three or four days. Room Design: Ok, but a let down from the photos online Shower: Impressive fixture with multi spray system (full body shower) but aside from this, spartan at best with no tub. Service: Pleasant and helpful at desk, but no room service, no in-suite amenities such as coffee maker, tea, etc. Room bar is stocked with a few basic items. Food: Breakfast is a basic english and continental combination. Definitely not four star, but would be acceptable if I did not have to pay an additional 30 Euros or so for the opportunity of eating it instead of spending the 10 or so Euros that it would have cost me to buy some wonderful pastries and espresso on the streets of Madrid, right outside the hotel. Location: Very good location in Madrid. This is a great hotel if you do not plan on spending much time at the hotel. Actually I will add that I saw an advertisement for free bike rentals at the hotel, which I did not try but I thought could be a nice touch. Worth inquiring about. Condition: Rooms in fair condition, hole showing in wall. Room smelled mildly of sewage (not kidding). Sound of running/dripping water when upstairs suite flushed toilet and showered made me confident the smell might really be sewage (what else smells like sewage?). Hallways are nice but main common areas (lobby, etc.) are in need of paint, updates and furnishing. White designer couch in entrance is filthy, paint is very dirty, etc. etc. I know this review sounds bad, but I am telling it how it is. Location is excellent and the hotel would be decent if it had been rated three stars and if the price was 30+ Euro cheaper including breakfast. I left feeling a little ripped off, lied to, and my back hurts more from the bed than from the plane ride to Madrid. If you are looking for a four star hotel and are used to four star service/comfort, do NOT book here. I am reading the previous reviews and shaking my head... trendy? luxurious space? who is writing this stuff???

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: ssberger
Reviews.Content: Our family of four had a great stay, we were in a quadruple with plenty of space! I would definetely stay here again. You can book this hotel with no worries! I did not have breakfast at the hotel because we wanted to taste different places and food. Have a great time in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy boutique hotel; great staff; like living in the heart of Madrid's old town!”
Reviews.Author: washbrol
Reviews.Content: The Petit Palace chain's Posada del Peine hotel is beside Madrid's ultra-popular Plaza Mayor square. This puts you at the cross-roads of the heart of Madrid, particularly as a tourist looking to discover the best active neighborhoods which radiate in all directions from this hotel. (La Latina, the royal palace, Puerta del Sol, Cheuca, Gran Via, others... Positives: -Lobby is rather small, but freshly modern and boutiquey -Staff was always very helpful, friendly, pleasant. Gave directions, called taxis in middle of night, laughed with the guests. -Room: Ours was a fantastic corner room, higher up. With a small balcony on each side, leaving the windows open looked directly 2m across to other apartments of local residents. Perhaps an intense vis-a-vis, but as you're above pedestrian-only passageways, result was the gentle sounds of voices echoing in the passages, footsteps, life circulating around. Felt like we lived there! Bathroom: New, modern glass-wall shower and sink, very clean. Negatives: None! Tip: Avoid eating in Plaza Mayor; I had one amazing meal/drinks/service in a corner restaurant with chairs on the square (i forget the name!), but most restaurants are poor quality tourist-class food and high tourist prices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent loacation”
Reviews.Author: TimWilliams
Reviews.Content: Well located, close to Plaza Major and within easy walking distance of most of Madrid's attractions. Rooms (ours) small but well equipped. Requests for blanket, towels etc dealt with promptly and efficiently. Good security, excellent breakfast with fresh fruit and much else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Taner_tr06
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights as 4 persons family. Room was clean, warm, quiet and with laptop. Wifi is free but with very low speed. Laptop in the room has unix operating system which is not usefull for majority. Breakfast was terrible. Very low species and all delicatessen was pork products as cheapest. I booked with breakfast and we had only 1 day breakfast, but I paid all with breakfast as they requested even i declared we had just 1 day breakfast. Location is very nice. You can stay for location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location/Terrible room (Triple room with a very low sloping ceiling)”
Reviews.Author: AyeshaA-F
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a great location but I'm in a triple room where the ceiling is sloping so low that we are in danger of banging heads and breaking necks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: culillo
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at the Posada del Peine as the location could not be better and it has so much history.I was not wrong, what a great feeling to open the door of the Hotel and see the Plaza Mayor. We were given a terrible room in the Attic, black ceiling, very claustrophobic and difficult to move around. The room need some TLC, curtains were failing apart, the door from the shower was loose, it just did not feel right...we could not sleep as one window did not close properly and the noise of the street did not end until 3am. Next day in the afternoon I asked at Reception if they could repair the window, the gentleman at Reception suggested to change us the room, he moved us to the 3rd floor and we were happily surprise with the difference of the room. All rooms have a computer with access to internet. All rooms only with showers, not bath One night my daughter was sick and after calling the Reception at 3am, they provide me with details of local 24H Chemist I found the Receptionist in the afternoon were more friendly and helpful that the ones in the morning. Next visit to Madrid I will pay a little bit more to have a better room with a bath and better facilities but it was a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: battybetty
Reviews.Content: we paid 200 euro per night for family room x4 without breakfast(408) Location fantastic. Attic room with black ceiling -no natural light/ no view and low artificial light. No space to move upright. Had to ask for extra covers on beds. Shower good, but flooded all bathroom. Towels not very clean. Tiny reception area. Free laptop + wifi but very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Not so clever design”
Reviews.Author: amsguy39
Reviews.Content: Our room (412) had some issues: it is under the roof and every time we walked to the bathroom or closet we had to do gymnastics as there simply is not enough room to walk. Second issue: they seem to save too much on energy and it is extremely dark in the corridors which makes it almost impossible to open the door. Lastly, the bathroom will flood when you take a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah M
Reviews.Content: We had been booked into a hotel for four nights by our tour company to stay a bit longer in Madrid after a two week tour of France and Spain. Suffice to say it was the worst hotel we had ever stayed and after one night we desperately needed to find a new, more comfortable hotel. The Manager on duty at Posada del Peine was fantastic. We dragged outselves in thinking either a) they would have no rooms, or b) the price would be too steep. We were pleasantly suprised when he said he could accommodate us and then he charged us a very reasonable rate. Throughout our stay he was very welcoming as were the rest of the staff. The Hotel is located a stone's throw from Plaza Major - the hub of Madrid. We could walk everywhere. The room was tastefully appointed in a very modern style. Although we were in the heart of the city over a weekend, the room was not too noisy. The hotel rooms come with a laptop and free wi-fi and breakfast is available. A great place to base yourself in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Shame About the Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: hedwig4080
Reviews.Content: Beautifully situated just off Plaza Mayor. Bit of a job getting large suitcases to the door as the taxi had to park down the road and we had to drag them along the cobbled streets. No way is this a 4 star hotel!!! The bathroom is a perspex box taking up a lot of space in the room, it has almost see through walls and no soundproofing and the door didn't fit. The decor was awful, it was supposed to be funky and cutting edge but it was just tired and outdated, it looked worn out 60's. Staff were, however, friendly and the breakfast was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here!”
Reviews.Author: NOTurTYPE
Reviews.Content: The Posada del Peine is among a chain of "high tech hotels" in Madrid. As we wandered around town I observed at least two others. I am not sure what makes them "high tech"? There is a laptop in each room which is included in the room price. There is also free wifi available. The old Dell was somewhat useful to check-in online or look at the train schedule though I am always reluctant to venture into my personal email or any bank account as I know key-stroke recorders and sniffers exist. (I don't want to hand anyone my login or password on a silver platter). There was nothing brilliant about this hotel. The room size was average (square) with a queen bed and a quarter of the space being taken up by a frosted glass cube which was the bathroom/shower. The wallpaper was dingy/worn as was the carpet. The light fixture were dated and the room as a whole appeared "worn". It's not dumpy, just worn and dated. The flat panel TV was hanging the wall swivel mount by one last bolt so I notified housekeeping - Nothing was ever done to correct. There is a breakfast spread available in the basement, however, we opted to wander out for all our meals. This location was great. One block from Puerta del Sol where you can catch the Metro to anywhere. Two train connections had use to the bullfights or soccer stadium (Real Madrid). It was also very easy to navigate to/from the airport via metro. The Plaza Mayor is a stone’s throw East. Many dining options but in our case, we ate little places off the beaten path with the locals and only drank and people watched in the Mayor. On the other side of Mayor was the market with fresh juices, breads, sushi, tapas... anything you could imagine. A little pricey but worth a visit after 11am. The Royal Palace is within 10 minutes walking as are many other attractions. I don't know if this was the "best location" to stay in Madrid but it did not disappoint us.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious with bathroom issues”
Reviews.Author: lump62
Reviews.Content: This was our first night in Spain and first of two nights in Madrid. We stayed at this hotel for one night at the beginning of our trip, than again one more night at the end of our trip some 12 days later. This room for our family of four was spacious, with a queen bed for my wife and I and bunk beds for the kids. Location, just 100 yards from Plaza Mayor and not much further from Puerta del Sol was fantastic. Laptop in room was nice, but connection a bit slow. Room was clean, beds comfortable and staff was helpful. We did not eat in the hotel. The draw back was the bathroom, which seems to be the norm in this chain. The frosted glass door had no latch to close it. The shower/tub, had a half glass shower screen which means you had to be careful when showering to not get the rest of the bathroom wet. There was a separate shower/sauna with no operating instructions, needing and engineering degree to get it to work, which we never did. Not too much street noise given the location.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: donegaldanny44
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the 22nd and 23rd of September 2011. We found the hotel to be clean and tidy. The rooms were more than adequate with everything you would need for a short stay. The staff were helpful and friendly and we had breakfast which we found to be great value. But most importantly the hotel is in a great location, central to everything. A couple of good tapas bars close to the hotel were La Descubierta and La Panera, definately worth a visit! The best way to get from the airport to Madrids main square is by metro, here are some helpful directions: After collecting your baggage, it's a bit of a walk to the exit. Keep walking towards the exit and eventually you'll see diamond shaped signs with "metro" on them; follow these signs (the entrance is inside the airport). - Each subway line is signified by a colour and a number. To differentiate between both directions each line takes, each one is signified by the final stop on that line in that direction. There is only one subway line to take from the airport, pink line (No. 8), and it only goes in one direction, so it's impossible to go wrong. There is an intercom system on the trains to announce consecutive stops. Stay on this line until the last stop, Nuevos Ministerios. Disembark and take the dark blue line (No. 10, direction Puerta del Sur) 3 stops to Tribunal. Disembark and take the light blue line (No. 1, direction Valdecarros) 2 stops to Sol. There are a number of exits but they are all in close proximity to each other on the main square.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but otherwise lacking.”
Reviews.Author: fjbLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: Overall I would agree with the previous few reviewers, it wasn't great but it wasn't atrocious. M Positives: Bathroom with massage shower, reasonable sized room, excellent location. Negatives: Service - a million miles from 4*, despite asking for various broken items (toilet seat, mini bar, door key thing) to be fixed on the first night & again on the second they were not, we were offered a new room for the 3rd and final night but declined as it seemed too much hassle . Decor - dated & in my opinion not at all boutique. Laptop in the room was extremely slow & dated - not very high tech really. Cleanliness could be improved especially in bathrooms (mouldy shower seal) Breakfast - offered as a good will gesture - having tried it we were glad we didn't pay the extra for it! Served in a cellar room, the hot food looked like it had been offered on more than one morning but cold selection was passable. Would recommend coffee & pastries etc in plaza mayor/elsewhere. We didn't have a problem with the beds as other reviewers found although offering a 2nd pillow would be nice. All in all I'd mark it "Must Try Harder".

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: JackoIII
Reviews.Content: We just left this hotel in Madrid. This is a great location right off Plaza Mayor. The front desk staff were very nice, but the room was very small and had a LOT of problems! Light bulbs out (never fixed after reporting), toilet seat broken and laying loose (fixed after reporting) and trim broken on the main writing table...it looks like this hotel needs a lot of loving maintenance attention.

Reviews.Title: “Allright, but...”
Reviews.Author: happytrailer33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in August. Simply OK, no more, no less. If you want to be close to the center of all things Madrid, then the location cannot be beat. However, the rooms are very tight (we had two separate rooms for our group and changed rooms twice, so we saw/stayed in a few), the beds fair (thin and a bit hard, but the pillows are terrible). The staff was pleasant, but not outgoing... The "high tech" profile of the place is a bit overblown. The rooms do have working laptops - a nice touch - but the decor and general feel of the rooms and public spaces is dated. Comments in other reviews about the funky smoked glass walls for the bathrooms are correct - different, but in a "why" sort of way. Prices were ok considering the location, but not for the quality. i would not say don't stay here, but do not expect to be wowed!

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms but great location”
Reviews.Author: Popcorn49
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights with my husband & 2 kids. The room was very small with a double bed & 2 singles. The bathroom was newly down with a bath & shower. The hotel is in a great location - just seconds from Plaza Mayor, with plenty of great restaurants & shopping nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great staff, "interesting" room”
Reviews.Author: Armarsolo
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a two week, multi-city visit to Europe and used Trip Advisor to screen and make a final selection our hotels. We were happy with all of the results. We were looking for hotels very close to, but not in the middle, of all of the “action” (to avoid noise but have easy access), close to a metro station (for daily use to other parts of the city), hotels that were close to public transportation from the airport (to avoid expensive cab fares), good facilities for a family traveling with a teen ager and one of her friends, and English speaking staff (while people in our group could speak a little of the local language, having English speaking staff added comfort for us). Internet access was important. We wanted a hotel rated at least a 4 or 5 by other reviewers and in the top 1/3 of all rated hotels, generally having positive comments by Trip Advisor reviewers. The Petit Palace Posada Del Peine (there were a couple of the Petit Palace hotels within the same area) met all of these criteria. It's centrally located, close to a lot of dining options for breakfast and other meals (the hotel has its own restaurant if you prefer- we like to explore and found a wide variety of food types and prices within an easy 5 miute walk), was within a couple of blocks of the metro station at Puerta del Sol (be aware that when taking the metro from the airport, there are a number of transfers and many require that you carry your luggage up or down stairs- but it is survivable and less expensive than a shuttle or cab). The front desk staff, spoke english and were very helpful in providing recommendations, setting up a tours, etc. We were able to walk nearly everywhere from the hotel. The Plaza Mayor is about 100 yards from the hotel and the Puerta del Sol is just a few blocks away. Both are centers of day and night life in the area. The Mercado San Miguel, a smaller, modern open market place, also is a few blocks away and was a great place to grab breakfast or a late night drink or snack. It really buzzes at night as a place to be, drink and meet people. Despite the hotel being very close to Plaza Mayor, the area is very quiet at night. There is no problem walking in the area. We needed a room for my wife and I, our teenage daughter and her friend. It was great that the Petite Palace offered family sized arrangements. Most had a bunk bed in addition to the paired single/double bed. Our room had the paired single bed/double bed and then two additional single beds for the girls. The room was located right at the roof line which created a sloping ceiling in the room and some tight head room if you were not paying attention. We though that this was fun rather than a detraction. The free internet and lap top computer in the room, in additional to another set of open computers on the lowest level, were a huge plus. The room had an easy to operate safety box for valuables. Air conditioning was very good for the hotter days that we had there. We loved our stay and the location, and are happy to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ericahub
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed in a family room, which consists of a queen bed and bunk beds. The room is a little small, but similar to other rooms in Europe. The hotel is very clean and comfortable, and the laptop with Internet was very useful. The hotel is very close to Puerta del sol and the metro, so it is very easy to get to. Also, you are about a fifteen minute walk from the palace, and the museums are about fifteen minutes walk in the other direction, so it is a perfect location

Reviews.Title: “value, location, quality, breakfast, wifi, all excellent”
Reviews.Author: rubencanuck
Reviews.Content: I cant say enough about this hotel. a 4 star trip advisor rating does not do it justice. the staff is amazing, plus all i mentioned above. for a 4 star hotel...this is one of the best. although our room is not huge, 3 adults fit perfectly well...oh and the laptop provided in the room??? thats a first for me. location IDEAL, it just does not get better than this. If you are travelling on a bit of a budget..in other words not wanting to spend 300 euros a night...this will make you very, very happy, and I am a travel agent by profession and am NOT getting a travel agent rate!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommendable”
Reviews.Author: Mel63_London
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent! Very central but quiet. The rooms are tastefully decorated and a free laptop/internet in the room was a great plus. We were 3 sisters sharing a room and even though it wasn't all that spacious we did fit in well. The personnel was friendly and helpful. Very good value for money. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for family of 4”
Reviews.Author: bgrove
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent and the family room was perfect for our family of 2 adults and 2 teens. While the room is not large, it is layed out very well. Having a laptop in the room is great feature.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely use again”
Reviews.Author: aoncamel
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff, lovely room with a great view over the street. Slightly odd bathroom though - it was like an opaque glass box! You couldn't see through the walls but if you turned the light on at night it lit up the whole room. In-room laptop was useful for looking things up. Would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Center of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: 1sunflower
Reviews.Content: Very good location, in the city center. Also from the subway station Sol, only 5 walking distance. Also near the Major square. We arrived at midnight but we found the hotel very easily. Reception staff gave us a welcome, really helpful and kind guy. All rooms have no bath tub but only shower. Being in the historical building, our triple room was not so big but it was enough. It seems that all rooms are new renovated and have a laptop - you can use at free of charge. Breakfast was nice, full of salami, cheese and hams.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel -- great location!”
Reviews.Author: RLDavis64
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for discovering the city, Right next to Plaza Mayor. Large room for family(separate bed area for parents + fold-away bunk beds for kids). Nice breakfast buffet. Laptop in room a big plus!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: pauld_7
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel located absolutely perfectly in the centre. The reception was small, and offered free coffee and cold water during the day. The room was quite small, but the bed was very comfortable. It was very quiet considering the location and we heard no traffic noise at all.I couldn't get the Wi Fi to work, but there was a laptop in the room with free internet access and we were listening to UK radio. The shower was lovely and powerful. The breakfast was the usual continental, ok but nothing special. Staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the center of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Cob55
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the middle of everything in Madrid. The hotel lobby is very small but safe as the desk clerks know who you are before letting you proceed upstairs. They were able to accomodate my family of 4 in one room. Great internet access and a laptop in the room. Not glamourous but very functional.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - no way 4*”
Reviews.Author: jobox
Reviews.Content: Pros: Fantastic central location, friendly and helpful reception staff, plenty of wardrobe space. Gave us complimentary cava and fruit as they had made a cock-up on the room booking. Cons: 3* not 4*. Very small room and not the size room we booked. No english TV channels/english subtitles. Bathroom sealant mouldy. Toiletries lacking, no hair conditioner and shampoo that left hair extremly dry. Complimentary tea/coffee is in reception, not in rooms, and only available at certain times of day. I would recommend as a base for sightseeing but not for spending days or eating at.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room good, but could use some work”
Reviews.Author: Debbie P
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was fabulous. The staff was delightful and helpful. Our room had its own laptop and was very nice. The only complaint I have is that the hallways were not air conditioned, dark and dingy. Could be better. Is a 3 star not a 4 star .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: blout
Reviews.Content: Loved my stay at the Petit Palace Posada del Peine!! The hotel is small and charming, perfectly located between all of the major sights of Madrid. Was originally concerned about noise after reading several reviews on Tripadvisor, but had no issues whatsoever -- even on the night when Spain made it into the semifinals of the World Cup (lots of celebration in the streets). Rooms are very clean, if a bit spare. My room had two double beds, which were comfortably firm. Air conditioning was terrific -- very helfpul given the hot weather during my stay. The bathroom was more spacious than I expected, with a terrific shower (though on some mornings, hot water seemed to run out). The only issues I had with my room were that the safe didn't work, the TV had no English-language channels whatsover, and WiFi did not work at all (unable to maintain a connection, as many others reported). Fortunately there is a Ethernet connection you can use as an alternative. Service here was extremely friendly and helpful. A friend of mine lost her passport and the front desk was amazingly considerate, allowing her to use the hotel phone to make some emergency calls. The Petite Palace isn't a luxurious hotel like the Westin or Ritz, but it has a lot of style and charm, and I would wholeheartedly recommend it to my friends, given the reasonable cost, fantastic service, stellar location, and clean accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located, if pretty barebones”
Reviews.Author: bbecca26
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be very clean and VERY well located. there is no point in paying for breakfast as there are 25 places to eat for much cheaper right out the door. however the beds and pillows were not particularly comfortable and the door to the bathroom in the room does not properly close or provide any privacy. but if you can get a good deal on a room, i would definitely recommend the hotel based on location and moderate comfort.

Reviews.Title: “not a 4 star hotel, no free wifi as advertised, but great location.”
Reviews.Author: tobyo99
Reviews.Content: I booked a triple room at this hotel several months before our arrival in mid-May. The room and bathroom were rather small which surprised me since this was listed as a 4 star hotel. We had a larger room and bathroom at our 3 star hotel in Barcelona. The chair at the desk had one footing missing so we called the front desk to replace the chair and they replaced it quickly. There was an electrical outlet that did not work. Luckily I only needed two outlets and there were two other outlets that did work. The closets did not close very well. The drapes were askew and did not open and close easily. There was no free wifi in the room even tho that was listed as an amenity. This was a huge disappointment for me as one big reason I booked this hotel was for the free wifi. There was free internet connection but it was not wifi, big difference. I was looking forward to letting my daughter use the laptop that was in the room so that I could use my own laptop at the same time. Couldn’t do it since I had to use the network cord to get online. I also did not like the glass door to the bathroom. When someone had to use the bathroom in the middle of the night, the entire room was lit up by the bathroom light. The hotel wasn’t all bad. You could not beat the location and that was another big reason I booked this hotel. The breakfast buffet was quite nice but one could find cheaper breakfast down the street. You’re definitely paying for convenience at the hotel, which was nice the one morning we took advantage of their breakfast. There is alot to choose from which was nice. We did get a room on the inside as requested as I worried about street noise, so that was nice. We did love the location but we felt it was not a 4 star hotel. It needs a bit of updating and to stop advertising free wifi when it is not available. In fact, I cancelled our reservation here for our last night in Madrid and we stayed at another 4 star hotel for the same price and enjoyed that one so much more. I wish I could recommend this hotel but struggle with that. If you’re just looking for a place to sleep right in the center of town and don’t care much about amenities, this is your place. If you’re looking for a 4 star hotel in the center of town, this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not high quality”
Reviews.Author: Heroneya
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rather a good 3 star hotel than 4 star. It might have been of high quality when renovated, but overall I can see the signs of the work once not well done and going down the hill. The location is great , though a bit noisy - remember your earplugs. The staff is somewhat friendly, they could work on it a bit more. The hotel is very dark (dark rooms, dark halls). The rooms are modern and well designed, but need improvement. Beds very comfortable. The breakfast was actually very, very disappointing. Very poor choice and not of the quality one would expect in a 4 star hotel. Nice to have laptop and high speed, but I couldn't really use wi-fi on my iPhone or Mac. That's a pity. Cleaning ladies came twice in and cleaned my room although I specifically asked them not to. Safety box works only with credit card. So if you put something in the safety box, take good care of your wallet and your credit card. If they get stolen, you can't opet deposit box anymore :) I would recommend the hotel because of its location, good beds and because it is a fine average hotel. But I would warn not to expect too much, in order to avoid disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holidayz2009
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in such an ideal location. Step outside the hotel and look left and you can see Plaza Major and a tiny walk the opposite direction will bring you to Puerta Del Sol. We also walked to Museo del Prado, Gran Via, Palacio Real and other various tourist spots. The lobby has free tea/coffee and juice from about 1200-2200 which is a nice touch on the way out for a long day. Reception staff are friendly and willing to help. There are also bikes to hire free of charge. I think we stayed in an upgraded room as we had three balconies, trouser press and an exercise bike in our room. We also had laptop and tv in our room but I think all rooms have this. The bathroom was a lovley size with a lovely fancy shower. It was handy having room temperature control as we needed the heating on in the night as it was chilly in March. The hotel has it's own restaurant and offers the option of breakfast if you haven't got this included in your rate. This was about 10 euros each and we felt it was too expensive so had a drink downstairs and some food from elsewhere. I really enjoyed this hotel and thought it was lovely and modern. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but hotel has gone down hill”
Reviews.Author: GarryDan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location but is definitely not 4 * but 3*. We stayed at this hotel 4 years ago when it was new and it was great. The rooms have become old looking and there hasn't been any updating or maintenance. Breakfast was good and the rooms have a laptop. Staff are friendly and very helpful. Madrid itself is great and we always enjoy going.

Reviews.Title: “Keep it simple...”
Reviews.Author: Cyclosomatic
Reviews.Content: If this hotel simply advised itself as a clean, quality hotel in a good location, it would be spot on. However, we booked it mostly because it promised free wireless and internet access and advertised itself as a High Tech Hotel. My iphone couldnt connect to the internet once. My laptop had terrible troubles with the wireless service. Don't promise what you can't deliver. More generally the walls are made from tissue paper so you can hear everything going on next door. The bathroom walls are also made from tissue paper so don't have any secrets from your partner. From a positive perspective, it is in a very convenient spot. It is clean and tidy and the staff are relatively helpful. However, it is not a high tech hotel and they should have used some, any (even newspaper) soundproofing.

Reviews.Title: “A Three Star Hotel in a Five Star Location”
Reviews.Author: TravDean
Reviews.Content: Posada del Peine is a three star hotel in a five star location. It is a streach to call it a four star hotel. Location is unmatched for a tourist. The buffet breakfast is of good quality, good variety, and well presented. The staff is young and friendly if not overly helpful. The free use of a laptop computer with internet access is a definite plus. The rooms are very small but with good sound insulation from street noise. There are no public siting areas. The room was reasonably clean except for a wad of chewing gum matted into the carpeting for which there was no evidence of any attempt to remove. For our five day stay, the room was not made up on two days. We had to ask for soap. We asked for an extra pillow...there was no response and no additional pillow. If it were not for the great location, I would not recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “good, but not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: yogimo
Reviews.Content: This is one of the more difficult reviews to write. I could say a some bad things about the hotel, but I could also write a very nice review. Guess all depends on what you are in Madrid for. Reception: Great Service, nice staff, friendly and helpful Rooms: Quite small, for a business traveller too small, as e.g.only one chair is in the room. Bathroom is quite large and good. Bed is comfortable. Computer is in the room (Laptop Dell), but the "working area" is very small and not well light. WLAN is working, but very badly. You often lose connection. Breakfast room: is in the basement - breakfast is not very large, but good quality. The variety of foods offered will, in my opinion, satisfy 99 % of all people. Business: Although it is called High Tech - it is not really high tech - there is no business centre, but at the reception I could print out something, using a USB stick. Location is good, but keep in mind, that you have to carry your bags about 100 m from the street / taxi, to the hotel. Overall I enjoyed the stay, although for business I would chose another hotel. For pleasure it is pretty good. Although there are many restaurants close to the hotel, I have not found one good / recommendable one. Either they were unreasonable expensive or the waiters were so rude, that you wanted to leave immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ary60
Reviews.Content: Location could not be better. Clean and crisp rooms, and staff helpful and friendly. Breakfast buffet style was quite good - though get down early as plates on buffet seem to empty and are not filled quickly enough. You can walk everywhere from the hotel and it was quiet at night even though it overlooks the Plaza Major. Enjoyed the stay there and would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location; great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Hellonophile20
Reviews.Content: Originally I had booked the stay at the paseo del arte, until I saw this hotel. I was glad I changed. It's in a brilliant location, just a stone's throw from the Plaza Mayor and less than two minutes walk from the Sol Train station. On foot, you are only 10minutes from the Palacio Real and probably 20 minutes from the Prado. Because the city is so buzzing you feel safe wandering around these main streets, as there are loads of places to get a drink or eat if you need them. If you are after general supplier - the El Corte Ingles Dept store has a brilliant supermarket in the basement. As a solo traveller I wasn't expecting a massive room, but still got a double/twin. It dominated the room, but there was more than enough room for just me. The bathroom was well appointed and the laptop was the main reason I booked there. You will need to bring your own kettle or you can use the tea/coffee machine down in reception but that inly becomes available after midday - not much good if you like a cuppa first thing! There's also a mini bar, but didn't bother to look into it. If you are staying on the Plaza Mayor, do not expect a silent room. However it was quite nice listening to the buzz of Madrid night life as I drifted off to sleep! My main gripe was the sound proofing between the walls, but think a lot of that was just my luck that my neigh had a small child who liked kicking the wall at inopportune times! Didn't hear anything from the corridor. I didn't have breakfast, but seemed reasonable at 10E. You could of course get something from a cafe instead, probably for cheaper. Had to say, having been to the famous Choclateria San Gines, and had Chocolate y Churros - i wasn't a fan. All in a all a good base for a couple of days sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart of the city - cn truelly b recommended”
Reviews.Author: Halimbalo
Reviews.Content: This is a real good hotel if you like to explore Madrid. You are right in the heart of the city some 100 meters from Plaza Mayor but it is not too noisy at all. The rooms are quite small but more then good enough if you are staying there mainly for sightseeing purposes. Aircondition is sufficient and they offer internet for free. Very good value for price. Take care of gipsys at Reteiro as they steel! (they want you to subscribe any foollish list and use your lack of attention to nick whatever they can - that cost me my camera). Another tip: to explore the city someway different try it on a Segway! A touroperator called Madsegs is offering a 3 hrs tour for € 60.- and its worh every cent! A true experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loud construction alert”
Reviews.Author: TravelOrchid
Reviews.Content: Loud construction noises early morning and all day ! Front desk staff was rude. Outside the hotel is a police car stationed there 24/7 and to access the hotel, you had to buzz to get in. Then I heard this area is a pick pocket/ robbery area. The taxi can't drop you near the hotel because the road is for pedestrians only.Trust me I'm not a picky person but we didn't feel welcome or safe at this hotel. There were other hotels in the area that looked better. Not sure what happened to this area in the last few months.

Reviews.Title: “Complete satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: engam
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights from 30/7/09. This was by far the best 4 * hotel I have stayed in Europe. The room was modern and funky. The bed was very comfortable and and every thing worked perfectly. There was an extensive spread of buffet breakfast. And most of all, very friendly and helpful young recptionists and staff. Bravo. Will definitely return and recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laura_Lou1983
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel we read some rather negative guest reviews regarding room size, leaking bathrooms etc, so weren't too sure what to expect. However our experience could not have been more positive. We were checked in without delay on arrival and were allocated a lovely room with a small balcony overlooking the street below. The room was perfectly clean, beautifully decorated and had everything we needed. The location of the hotel could not have been better - one minute's walk from the Sol metro stop and really easy to find. The staff were very helpful and the breakfast on offer was excellent; much better than many other 4 star hotels i've stayed in. All in all, we had a wonderful stay here. I would thoroughly recommend it and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Checkmatecheck
Reviews.Content: Hotel was located a few steps away from the Plaza Major in a building dating back from around 1610. The place has all the conveniences of a world class hotel, except fitness room or pool. The four star rating, however, is a bit of a stretch. The rooms are cozy (eg. very small), equipped with internet capable laptops, very firm beds with thin pillows, shower with no bathtub. Reception staff was courteous and helpful, the cleaning staff could be a bit more motivated, judging by the overall cleanliness and repair of the room. A bit noisy in the late morning, but tolerable. If you plan to spend a lot of your time in a hotel room you might want to consider another hotel. If your stay in Madrid is about sightseenig and enjoying of the city vibe and energy this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, well set up for free wifi internet and excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Vonneytraveldotcom
Reviews.Content: Definately a good value tourist hotel - no smart lounges, but good basics in a central location. Very clean, simple rooms and excellent showers. Very basic toiletries- so take your own. Good hi tech throughout the hotel and every room has a laptop and free wifi should you need to use your own equipment. (rare even in a 5 star). Very friendly helpful staff, who speak good English. Excellent breakfast - worth taking the package - fresh fruit, and orange juice, then cold meats, and a hot buffet. Also fresh pastries etc. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: urtus
Reviews.Content: only few meters from plaza mayor. The location is great for tourism, culture and shopping. Rooms are little but clean. There's a laptop with internet in each room (very useful!). My room was in the backside and it wasn't possible to open the window (because of an unbelievable and permanent stink). Don't book this hotel if you look for triple/quad room, they are too small!

Reviews.Title: “Check with Hotel before you Leave for Spain”
Reviews.Author: Lucky29
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Madrid and took a cab to the hotel. When we arrived, we were told that there had been a "catastrophe" with the roof, and we were being moved to another hotel. The other hotel, which was very nice, was about a mile away from the area we wanted to be in. They took us over in their van. It changed the nature of our trip, because we were no longer staying in the Plaza Mayor/Puerto del Sol area.

Reviews.Title: “Mini Break in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: BeanieDublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Madrid before and spent 3 nights at this hotel in early August 2008. Very easy to find, super location (less than 1 minute walk from Plaza Mayor, 3 minutes from Puerta del Sol). Short walk from the Royal Palace, Almudena Cathedral and many other tourist attractions. Substantial breakfast at the hotel at "tourist-friendly" times - perfect for those who like to stay out late to sample Madrid's night life (breakfast served until 10:30 Monday to Friday and til 11:00 on Saturdays and Sundays). Rooms are a little small but with excellent air conditioning (a must as the temperature reached 37/38 degrees celsius at this time of year) Bathroom was tastefully decorated and showers were very powerful with the option of massage spray. In the reception, a ready supply of chilled water and tea/coffee was available for guests between 10am and 10pm which was an excellent idea. Overall, highly recommended for a city centre stay in historical Madrid and pretty good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in wonderful location but room for improvement...”
Reviews.Author: EugeC
Reviews.Content: Posada del Peine has a great location off the touristy Plaza Mayor. Restaurants, shops, and more are within a few feet of the hotel doorway in a safe-looking locale. Peine Posada features the modern style and helpful staff that seem to be trademarks of the Petit Palace group of hotels. Our room was clean, of adequate size, and comfortable. However, the hotel could be improved along several dimensions -- for example, it has room safes that require credit card swipes to activate and at least one staff member apparently overlooking a 'do not disturb' sign. Finally, Peine Posada feels slightly cramped, particularly in its lobby and elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Marianoushka
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this hotel, arriving on New Year's Eve, and absoultely loved it! The hotel decor is gorgeously cosy but modern and the exterior is so colourful. The hotel is situated in a pretty cobblestoned street, walking distance from Plaza Mayor and Puerta del Sol. The location is fantastic (espcially on New Year's eve - being able to walk to the celebrations). When we entered our room we were greeted with a mini bottle of champagne and some delicious almond Spanish sweets to welcome in the new year. An unexpected and very thoughtful touch. The room was spotless, comfortable and had a great shower. Breakfast was delicious!! We would definitely stay here again!! NB - Just make sure you check the cost of any overseas & local landline calls you may wish to make from the room!! We were caught out. We knew to expect the calls to be expensive but the price was outrageous!!

Reviews.Title: “Vastly Over-rated!”
Reviews.Author: BirdsSeattle
Reviews.Content: Coming into Madrid after 3 weeks in Catalunya, we checked brand new Lonely Planet for a last-minute recommendation. This hotel was "Author's Choice", though it turned out to be 50% more expensive than listed. Well located it is, but so are many, many other lodgings. The young staff were cheerful. However, our 150 Euro room matched other reviewers comments: one third a bathroom, cramping our ability to move around the bed. Messy no-drain sink, no soap dish. Cheesy hand-painted art on the wall, a truly minimal effort. None of the lights on one side of the bed worked, nor were repaired after comment. It took two requests to get an extra blanket brought to the room. No bathrobes. Over-priced breakfast in a windowless basement room...what a way to start the day! It was pouring rain...no umbrellas. This is 4 star? Skip this one, folks, unless nothing else available. We moved to a hostal within a block: comfortable, half the price, incredibly friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Patatone
Reviews.Content: Booked through LastMinute.com on Monday morning, arrived Tuesday lunchtime for 3 nights. Reservation ready. Very friendly staff, clean room with great shower/en-suite and laptop with internet connection, security safe in room. We had a small room (but big enough for our requirements as we were out most of the time) on top floor with view of internal courtyard walls, but SO quiet even with open window, it was bliss. Fabulous position almost in Plaza Mayor and convenient for just about everything. We saw other Petit Palace hotels in town but all in much noisier venues. Would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chen04
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Spain for the first time last month with our three month old baby. We stayed at Petit Palace Posada del Peine in Madrid for several days and had a very good experience there. We found it to be a very nice, personal boutique hotel. The location just off Plaza Mayor is a great home base for exploring old Madrid on foot, and is just a couple of blocks from the Sol subway station, though we took the subway only to get from the airport to the hotel (probably a mistake as the Madrid subway system is not very baby stroller freindly -- we had to contend with lots of stairs, though I should note that the local people were very kind and people did stop to assist us several times). The hotel is in a very old building (as evidenced by exposed beams in the stairwell), but is attractively decorated in a funky contemporary urban style. There is a tiny European style elevator and only one step to get in the front door, which was great when using the baby stroller. The room itself was quite small (not really a huge concern for us), but it had good amenities such as a really nice shower, and a laptop computer with internet access. There was also free juice and coffee available in the lobby in the evenings, which was a nice detail. Our room faced into an inner courtyard, so while we had no view at all, we also had none of the street noise issues our guidebook had warned about. The front desk staff were young and friendly, and all had at least some ability to speak English. A few spoke excellent English. The girls made a great fuss over our baby every time we came and went, and made us feel very welcome. They also were very accomodating in allowing us to use their microwave to sterilize our baby's bottles. The hotel was always immaculately clean. All in all a very good experience for the money and we would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....for a Short Stay.”
Reviews.Author: mumof03boys
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for itś excellent location. We were not dissappointed! Being just off the Plaza Mayor, we were right at the heart of things (and still very little noise!) The hotel inside has a very modern and contemporary feel. A complete contrast with the outside of the building, which is said to be almost 400 years old! We had a family room which I thought was on the small side. However, for a short stay the location of this hotel more than makes up for the small sized rooms. Our family room did have two plasma screen TVś and a laptop with free internet access (to keep the kids busy, while we rested!) The bathrooms will probably not be to everyones taste....only frosted glass to separate them from the bedroom! Overall, I would say this hotel was 4 star on location and maybe 3 star otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rangerfan23
Reviews.Content: First let me say that we originally booked in at the Petit Palace Alcala Torre because we were a group of 3 adults looking to share accommodations and they were one of the more centrally located hotels which was reasonably priced. My husband and I had stayed in a Petit Palace Hotel when we went to Valencia last year so we knew what we were getting into. When we arrived at the Alcala Torre, the woman at the desk was confused and said we didn't have any reservations there. Thank goodness I printed out my travel arrangements as proof. Upon further investigation, she found that we had been moved to the Posada de Peine. We made our way over there and when we went to check in, they were unable to find our reservations either! The staff were lovely and helpful and eventually we were given our room. Our room was a seperate bedroom and a room with a bunk bed in it so there was some privacy. Both bed areas had a plasma tv. There was a laptop in the room with free wifi that would serve a business traveller well. The bathroom was clean as was the rest of the room. The petit palace chain is not a place I would recommend for someone who wants to spend more than two nights in Madrid, but if you just want somewhere to lay your head and relax with some comforts, than this is the place for you. The location is unbeatable and the staff were always very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Small”
Reviews.Author: StourGrove
Reviews.Content: Good location but very small rooms. We booked a Family room, which in fact appeared to be a normal double room with a camp bed erected in a very small space - barely room to swing a cat! Bathroom modern but the sink is badly designed (flat basin which meant poor drainage). Coridoors badly lit. Thin walls, meant we could hear our loud, Dutch, neghbours every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Location saves this hotel from its lack of function”
Reviews.Author: finicky1
Reviews.Content: First of all, this hotel is not luxurious nor 4-star. It is average at best so if you don't want to pay high prices for not much, scroll to the bottom of this review for a possible reasonable option. And as nice and hard-working as the young adults working the front desk are, this hotel is so understaffed. This chain needs to step it up at this hotel to be charging so much. Booked a room despite some reservation about noise despite the pedestrianized streets the hotel's on. The double-paned windows did such a good job, we actually opened the windows when we came in during the day (but didn't need a siesta) so it wouldn't be completely silent. A plus. The room was on a quiet side street rather the main entry side which may have been a bit noisy according to previous reviews. Our room had large stains on the carpet which made us wonder if it was clean. The bed was just fine. Liked the room lighting fixtures which worked well with the modern theme of the room, bathroom and hotel. But paintings of these twisty, branchy trees on the room wall and hotel walls didn't work - they gave the hotel the feel of an amateur artist w/ a penchant for organic, wisty, knotty branches. Better to have left the walls blank if they were trying to save money on decor. The hallways are lit w/ cobalt blue lights on very dark-stained hardwood floor. Very whimsically futuristic- different from any other hotel hallway. Now we're back on track.... The bathroom we had wasn't as bad as the one pictured in the candid photo where it was less than a foot from the bed. Ours was "down the hall" like a regular hotel room. It had the modern square sink out of which water splashed everywhere and didn't drain well at all. No soapdish (and this is a "4-star"? - whoever rated this place better think again). The hi-tech shower was like a car-wash for humans (but not that difficult to operate) - but it's only good if you're 6-foot or taller as the "back" massagers will hit your neck/head if you're shorter. Again, whoever designed this bathroom had no concept of function as your bathroom will get very flooded; which should only acceptable hostals and pensions/if at all. It doesn't help that this flooded area is also exactly where the toilet is situated, so if you don't want to do you business w/ out your feet in a pool of water, better use all the towels to sop it up. And the toliet is so very darn close to a wall, every time you sit down, unless you're a very small child, your face will g-r-a-z-e the wall. This interior designer needs a refresher course BIG TIME. Also, they claim to provide juice, coffee, tea, etc in the lobby for guests (is that why we paid 4-star prices?). As the machine was broken the replenished beverages went down into the drainage area rather than into the cups - all we got that weekend was cold water when we could have really used some caffeine now and then during the day. The price we paid for the first night was outrageous (don't know if it was because it was the weekend or that this happened to be their National Holiday weekend) but at about 130Euros/night the second night, while still high, was a little more justifiable. Across from our balcony, I saw adults staying at Hostal Sol Cruz. While I'm not a hostal person anymore (thanks to the dirty ones in Barcelona and Paris w/ loud, obnoxious high school and college kids that scared me back into my moderately-priced shell), I would have stayed there as I didn't hear any raucous people hanging out their balcony and the price of the hostal was only 1/3 of the price of what we paid. The hostal had the same view and quiet as our hotel, and some rooms were even on a higher floor. And it looked fine albeit basic (but didn't sound to function worse than our room) and got excellent reviews on this website. I would NOT pay more than 90Euros in high season. Not that I'm ever going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Karina28
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is situated just off Plaza Mayor. The whole area is pedestrianised and there are numerous bars and restaurants all around the area. We had a family room and it was a great size, a double bed in one area and bunk beds in the other area. There were 2 plasma screen TVs. The bathroom was a good size with a great shower. There was free coffee/tea and water available from noon to 11pm in the reception area. In the basement were two computers with internet access which were free also, and my two boys made good use of them. The reception staff were extremely pleasant (they seem to work very long hours!!) and had good english which made our life easier. We will definitely make a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Redmarley
Reviews.Content: It had so much potential, but wow was it awful. Here is a sampling of the list of events: - only smoking rooms available when we had booked a non-smoking room. Need to complain for 15 minutes before switching our room. - the switch landed us on an all kids (6-12) floor, who decided to run around slamming doors in the morning. - Sheets were changed and we were given dirty ones. Requested this be fixed as we went out for dinner, came back later to find them sitting on the bed. And they were the wrong size! 20 minutes of explaining at 2am, we got more sheets, still the wrong size. It is so close to so many things, but they simply could not care less about you as a guest. If everything goes right, then it could be a good place to stay. But if something goes of course, be warned they will not want to make it better and you will need to sit at the front desk for 15-20 minutes each time to get them to care. Terrible, terrible, terrible. (not to mention it is an expensive hotel).

Reviews.Title: “UNBEATABLE LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowLance
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel would be difficult to beat - so close to plaza mayor, good shopping, the royal palace, bus and metro links. Only had 2 days to spend in the city so being in the heart of everything was important and the hotel location surpassed all expectations. Staff were extremely helpful and responded quickly and positively to anything we requested. Rooms are good - comfortable beds, fabulous shower although some screens need to be longer. Take advantage of the very good value breakfast if you are on room only basis - far exceeds anything you will find in nearby cafes. Bathrooms do not allow for maximum privacy as a frosted screen rather than wall separates the bedroom area from the bathroom but the quality of fixtures is very good. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel when I return to Madrid, or to recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: EileenLiverpool
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel and good value at £80 per night for a double room. Located just off the Plaza Major.Staff very helpful about booking taxis, trips etc. Nice little restaurant in the basement and a very good breakfast which was included in the price I paid.Good selection of items. One of the plus points was the free internet access from the two laptops in the basement.Superior rooms apparently come with their own laptops or you can hire one for 20 euros per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: lamontravel
Reviews.Content: The Petit Palace was a great hotel in every way: location, cleanliness, and friendly, helpful staff. It is located just a few hundred feet from the Plaza Mayor where outdoor cafes and street performers abound! We were traveling with our two kids, ages 9 and 11. We were very comfortable in the Family Suite that had the kids bunk beds in a different section around the corner of the bathroom from our bed. That allowed for some privacy. The breakfast spread was extensive and included in our price of 125 euros a night. We would definitely stay there again if we go to Madrid in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Up to scratch!”
Reviews.Author: davebellmk
Reviews.Content: Booked triple room through Easyjet for £90 per night for 3 nights from 3rd September. Along with cheap flights made it a bargain on paper, and so it proved. we were prepared for the place to be a bit "off the wall", but it was only mildly so, for what we saw. My main points would be the hotel's marvellous location for tourists, and as has been mentioned, the front desk staff, especially the lead lady were very efficient, helpful and all-round nice, especially for a big city hotel! No complaints at all - possibly for our taste too big a contrast between the unbroken sunshine outside, and the dimly-lit room, but hey! so what. Just a standard triple on the first floor, but quite enough room for three adults, and NO problem with noise at all. we were room-only, but nice touch was to offer delicious coffee of varying flavours, or fruit juice/chilled water free from noon to 22.00 in reception lobby. We would return here like a flash on these terms.

Reviews.Title: “Fair-Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Verdad
Reviews.Content: Pros: Steps from the Plaza Mayor. Quick stroll to Puerta del Sol, Callao & Grand Via. Convenient for all major tourists sites. However, this is not the "real Madrid". The area around Plaza Mayor is filled with tourists and at night, college aged kids going out for a good time. The staff was friendly and helpful (I speak Spanish, though, so that helped). The rooms were clean, bright and well maintained. Cons: They screwed up our reservation. When we got there they informed us that the family room that sleeps four which we reserved months ago was not available. They offered us the same type of room at a different location (Torre de Alcala). We were so wiped out from the travel and luggage walk, we just asked to give us two double rooms instead. Steps from the Plaza Mayor - can be loud and a little "honky tonk". This is great if you're there for a girls/guys weekend, but I would have preferred something less commercial, honky tonk with the kids. Also, really inconvenient if you have to pull a lot of luggage, it's in a pedestrian zone and a cab can't pull up. Have to lug your bags about a block. I hated the dark hallways, you can't find your key to go into the room in your bag. In retrospect, we should have gone to the Torre de Alcala - we saw it later in literature and it looked nicer and a better neighborhood right near the Retiro and Prado.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: c-mac20
Reviews.Content: Pros: The hotel was uniquely decorated and the hallways vere very interestingly lit. This ambience made for a unique stay. The in-room lap-top was very conveinent and the television was of superior quality. The lighting in the room was also very positive. The breakfast was amazing!!! Finally, the location is perfect and unbeatable. Cons: The room came with a cot even though we didn't request it. The High Tech shower which many reviewers have highlighted did not work. The double bed was essentially two twins pushed together. This was both awkward and uncomfortable. It was loud but not unbearable, that was the trade-off for such a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, not so great service”
Reviews.Author: treisi
Reviews.Content: We had high hopes for this hotel, which looked so unique online. The location cannot be argued - you are steps from Plaza Mayor and the Puerta del Sol. However, the service left much to be desired and the room wasn't as unique as we had hoped. The building itself is beautiful and the free WiFi was nice. However, the staff seemed young and uninterested in truly caring for the people staying there. We stayed there for 2 nights and saw 3 people at the front desk complain while we were there. I would only recommend staying there for the location and if you have low expectations of service or simply don't care to be treated with any kind of special attention.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: TravellingGurlUk
