Reviews.Content: I've stayed in quite a few hotels in this chain, and this was the best so far. Easily accessible from the Metro (1 minute walk away), and close to cafes, shops and bars. It is in a pedestrianised area, so there is no traffic. There is some noise from metal shutters at nearby businesses closing late at night, and opening up in the morning, but nothing like the noise I've experienced elsewhere in Spain (including Madrid). I was initially put in a large (2 bed) smoking room against my booking request - and it was the smelliest room I've ever encountered. On complaining I was immediately moved to a non-smoking room - which was even bigger - there were 3 single beds, and a small balcony overlooking a narrow street. The bathroom had a hi-tech power shower and a 'marble' trough type sink. The bathroom walls were sandblasted glass - I'd not stay in this chain except when travelling alone; they all have the same bathroom 'concept' which doesn't offer the total privacy that we Brits require! Although the hotel staff understood English, they didn't appear to speak it - but that didn't present any problems to me. The corridor lighting is wierd - there are blue lights by each room door, and that's all. Rather like walking around a spaceship... I'm guessing there were problems with light leaking under room doors, and the blue light prevents this. I did not have breakfast here; free coffee and fruit juice is supplied from 11am in the foyer, and there is a water cooler. I would definitely stay here again if travelling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: drummaster
Reviews.Content: Hotel was good, excellent location close to plaza mayor and the main shops. Great bars and eating places around, all within walking distance. Hotel was well equiped with free wi-fi. Rooms were nice, nice bathrooms, excellent powerful showers but floor was prone to getting very wet due to small shower screens. Staff were friendly. Probably wouldn't rate it as a 4* though, more 3. Overall good and fairly priced.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: nervoustraveller125
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel due to advice from trip advisor and because the hotel had no bad reviews. It was a worry off my mind and as it lived up to expectations helped to make the stay more enjoyable. The hotel was in a pleasant spot just yards from the beautiful Plaza Mayor. Madrid was useasonably cold and we couldn't work out the heating system but were given an extra blanket which helped. I'd have no hesitation in recommending the place - an old building, tastefully modernised which was well appointed with stylish bedroom and an excellent shower.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Nice Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Teatros
Reviews.Content: I kicked off my Spanish vacation with 2 nights at the Petit Palace Posada Del Peine (which is part of the High Tech Hoteles). Upon arrival from the airport, the cab driver had to drop me off down the street from the hotel as it is on a pedestrian street - but it is RIGHT on the Plaza Major - fantastic. The hotel itself is very modern in decor, the folks at the front desk spoke English well and were helpful in getting me acclimated. There is even a computer in the lower floor of the hotel where guests may check their email (no charge for the use or internet time on the computer). The hotel room itself was cute (see pics attached) but by far the BEST part was the shower. THE most amazing shower - a rain showerhead overhead, plus two long sprayers on either side for your back with terrific water pressure. Because the hotel is so centrally located, there was some noise at night, but not enough to bother you if you're a sound sleeper. The hotel is in a safe location and I liked it enough that I would stay there again or venture to another High Tech Hotel (the one up the street at Puerta del Sol looked cool, too).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and a good 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Samjas
Reviews.Content: For anyone wishing to stay in a very central location, this is the place to be. A 1 minute walk from plaza mayor and a 2 minute walk from puerta del sol, this location offers great places to eat and drink on your doorstep. In all fairness everything is in walking distance and I'm not really a walker so thats saying something. As for the hotel, very pleasant staff, the rooms are clean, comfortable and modern. Certainly a 3+ star rating. Breakfast was not bad and there's free internet access in the restaurant area (2 pc's). We stayed for three nights with 2 kids (11 and 15) and they thoroughly enjoyed Madrid. Street entertainers in both the above two locations. Plaza de la Cibeles a must see, along with parc retiro, buy sourveniers at plaza de canovas de castillo( the neptune fountain), atocha station with its tropical gardens is another must see. On the down side I must say that I found the majority of the restauranteers rude and impatient, so you've been warned!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: mityfinn
Reviews.Content: Great location ,pleasamt staff but room a bit tatty .Certainly a 3+ experience but not 4+ as expected from previous reviews.....Leo. England

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Position”
Reviews.Author: MACtravelUK
Reviews.Content: Booked through Laterooms (slightly cheaper than Expedia). The position of this hotel is ideal for exploring the centre of Madrid, most things being within walking distance or a short Metro ride from Sol (the nearest station). We took the Metro from the airport to Sol and then walked the last bit to get to the hotel, probably the quickest way to get there (and definitely the cheapest). The hotel is decorated in a modern style but has retained some of the original features of the building. Our room for four was spacious, clean and quite well appointed with an exercise bike, trouser press, internet access complete with computer and air conditioning (although this could only be made to heat, not cool, perhaps because they think that no-one will get too hot in February). The kids had bunk beds and we had a king size bed, the mattresses were firm but OK. Some people have complained of small rooms but this one was absolutely fine. There was some street noise at night but in the middle of a spanish city you have to expect this, we had the same in Seville. The bathroom was trying to hard to be funky and modern. The sink looked great but was impractical, the shower was good but could have been bigger. Plenty of towels were provided, including four large bath towels. The broadband access was very useful, I took my own PC although one is provided in the room. The wireless link wanted a sign-in but I unplugged the ethernet cable from the hotel's PC and stuck it in my machine and was able to see the internet within seconds. Very useful for looking up restaurants and checking for opening times for galleries etc. We did not eat in the hotel and did not eat breakfast there either, there are so many places around the hotel to get breakfast of all types that it is a shame to stick to the hotel breakfast (which is also not cheap either compared to the many places around and about). Overall, excellent value for money. There are good shopping opportunities around Puerta del Sol and the streets north of there, great art galleries including the Reine Sofia and the Thyssen and good tapas bars and restaurants around the Plaza de Santa Ana. We found a couple of great bars which served terrific tapas, don't judge by external experiences, just look through the windows and see how full they are and if people are eating. If a place is still empty at 9 o' clock, don't go in. I'm afraid I didn't note the names of the bars we used but it is easy to find decent ones.

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfect”
Reviews.Author: logical
Reviews.Content: We (wife + 2 daughters) just returned from a one week vacation to Madrid. We stayed at Posada del Peine and found it close to perfection for the price. Great location. Staff is very helpful and friendly. Got quick directions to places, eating recommendations. Our room for four people was spatious, warm and quiet. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic decor, central location”
Reviews.Author: Linda77
Reviews.Content: very central location beside plaza mayor and close to restaurants shopping and transport. hotel is funky - well decorated modern rooms yet a beautiful old building really contrasts with the decor. the bathroom was fun - a frosted glass room wit huge shower and modern fittings including for once a great hairdryer! you don't have much privacy though. our room was a little small as it was a corner room but did have two balconies out onto the pedestrianised street below.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: travelingnewlyweds
Reviews.Content: I can't believe there were 4 stars on the outside of the hotel! The only nice thing I can say is that the location is great and that the hotel looks nice from the outside. Otherwise, my husband and I really couldn't believe how bad this hotel was. The staff was not especially friendly, the room was rediculously small, it was filthy and the bed was SO uncomfortable. The hallway was pitch black. The dining area smelled awful and was very depressing. I don't recommend this hotel at all. Hope this is helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Tristanfarnon
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights late September 2006. The hotel is cute and clean and the location is great. We had a fantastic room. The location is excellent, in the heart of old Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small room”
Reviews.Author: jplondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night. The location is great: central Madrid, close to Plaza Mayor, and relatively quiet. The room was nicely decorated (contemporary and good taste) but incredibly small. It seemed to me that, in order to have private bathrooms, they ´shortened´ the room space.

Reviews.Title: “cant wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: rach55
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from 5 nights at this hotel whist in madrid to watch the world badminton championships and we all loved it. it was a 3 minute walk from the metro (sol) to the hotel so very easy to there from the airport, even with our suitcases. the location is totally amazing, 30 seconds to plaza mayor and easy walking distance to the palace. there is a nice mix between the old and new with great shops also only a few minutes away. we loved the small bar outside the hotel for relaxing drinks and snacks. the hotel is great, very clean, friendly staff and free internet. we stayed in a family room which was big enough and the bathroom was lovely, amazing power shower! i stayed with my boyfriends family and we were not at all bothered by the glass divide as its all frosted glass and you cant see a thing. we payed for breakfast as we knew we would be inside the badminton hall all day long, and we loved it. great coffee and you can eat whatever you want really, fruit, cereal, ham, cheese etc, but also eggs, bacon, spanish omlet and of course lots of cakes and pastries. we ate so much we didnt have to eat again till the evening so great value for money. overall, we had a great holiday, loved the hotel and fell in love with madrid. i would recommend it to everyone.
